descriptions: Does not attempt to compare the numbers or uses incorrect symbols without justification.
Attempts to compare numbers but frequently makes errors in identifying the place values or uses the incorrect symbols.
Compares numbers, but makes occasional errors in using the correct symbols (=, >, <) or in identifying the place values.
Mostly accurately compares three-digit numbers but may need slight prompting to correct minor errors or omissions.
Accurately compares most three-digit numbers, using the correct symbols, with minimal to no errors. Shows clear understanding of place value.

Consistently and accurately compares three-digit numbers using >, =, and < symbols, demonstrating a thorough understanding of place value concepts. Can also explain the reasoning behind the comparisons.
Shows no understanding of place value (hundreds, tens, ones) and cannot identify the value of digits in the numbers.
Demonstrates a limited understanding of place value, struggling to identify the values of digits in the hundreds, tens, and ones places.
Understands place value to some extent but has difficulty in accurately determining the values of digits when comparing numbers.
Demonstrates a solid understanding of place value, accurately identifying the values of digits in most cases when comparing numbers.
Shows a strong understanding of place value and accurately uses this knowledge to compare numbers and justify their answers.
Exhibits a comprehensive understanding of place value and can articulate how the values of digits influence the comparison of numbers. Can also apply this understanding to more complex scenarios.
Does not use the correct symbols or is unable to record the comparison using the appropriate symbols.
Uses the symbols incorrectly or confuses the meaning of the symbols, demonstrating a lack of understanding of their use.
Uses the symbols with some accuracy but makes errors in placing them correctly between the numbers being compared.
Mostly uses the correct symbols but may occasionally make mistakes in recording the comparison.
Consistently uses the correct symbols (>, =, <) to accurately record the comparison of three-digit numbers.
Expertly uses and interprets the symbols to accurately record comparisons, and can also explain why a particular symbol is appropriate in a given comparison scenario.
